qas.question: What group made up most of Japan's first exchange students?
What was Iwasaki's relationship to samurai?
What kind of schools did samurai start?

context: <a0_0>Samurai<a0_0/> were many of the early exchange students, not directly because they were samurai, but because many samurai were literate and well-educated scholars. Some of these exchange students started <a3_0>private schools for higher educations<a3_0/>, while many samurai took pens instead of guns and became reporters and writers, setting up <a4_0>newspaper companies<a4_0/>, and others entered governmental service. Some samurai became businessmen. For example, <a1_0>Iwasaki Yatarō<a1_0/>, who was the <a2_0>great-grandson of a samurai<a2_0/>, established Mitsubishi.
